description: Demonstration of PressMate AI creating a brand‑compliant, SEO‑optimized press release for a corporate social responsibility initiative, generating a media list and scheduling the release for distribution.

messages.content: You are PressMate AI, an agentic LLM that converts internal briefings, corporate style guides, and SEO keywords into polished press releases, media lists, and scheduled publications.

We need a press release for our new CSR initiative – “GreenFuture Program” – launching next month. It should follow our brand tone (see style guide at https://example.com/styleguide.json), include SEO keywords, and be ready for distribution to tech media in North America. Please also generate a media list and schedule the release for 2024-11-15 09:00 UTC on PRNewswire.
Got it! I’ll start by extracting the core event details from your briefing.

arguments.briefing_text: GreenFuture Program – Our company is launching a new corporate social responsibility initiative called the GreenFuture Program. The goal is to reduce carbon emissions across our supply chain by 25% by 2027. Launch event will be held on 2024-12-01 at our headquarters in San Francisco. Key spokesperson: Jane Doe, VP of Sustainability. The program includes a $5M investment in renewable energy projects, employee volunteer days, and a partnership with CleanAir NGO. Benefits: lower operational costs, stronger brand reputation, and contribution to the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

messages.content: {"title":"GreenFuture Program Launch","date":"2024-12-01","location":"San Francisco headquarters","spokesperson":"Jane Doe, VP of Sustainability","goal":"Reduce carbon emissions across the supply chain by 25% by 2027","investment":"$5M in renewable energy projects","partner":"CleanAir NGO","key_points":["Employee volunteer days","UN Sustainable Development Goals alignment"]}
Next, I’ll fetch your corporate press‑release style guide.

{"tone":"professional and optimistic","headline_style":"title case, max 10 words","brand_colors":{"primary":"#0066CC","secondary":"#00CC99"},"font":"Arial, 11pt","branding":"include logo at top","footer":"© 2024 Example Corp. All rights reserved."}
Now I’ll generate SEO‑optimized keywords for the release.

arguments.topic: GreenFuture corporate sustainability program renewable energy carbon reduction

messages.content: ["greenfuture program","corporate sustainability","renewable energy investment","carbon emission reduction","supply chain greening","CleanAir partnership","UN SDGs","environmental responsibility"]
With the details, style guide, and keywords, I’ll draft the press release.

event_details.title: GreenFuture Program Launch
event_details.goal: Reduce carbon emissions across the supply chain by 25% by 2027

messages.content:
### GreenFuture Program Launch

*San Francisco, CA – December 1, 2024* – **Example Corp** is proud to announce the launch of the **GreenFuture Program**, a bold initiative aimed at reducing carbon emissions across its supply chain by 25% by 2027. The program represents a $5 million investment in renewable‑energy projects and a strategic partnership with **CleanAir NGO** to accelerate the transition to cleaner operations.

“*Our commitment to sustainability is at the heart of everything we do,*" said **Jane Doe, VP of Sustainability**. "*The GreenFuture Program not only helps the planet, it drives innovation, reduces costs, and aligns us with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.*"

Key components of the GreenFuture Program include:
- **Renewable Energy Investments** – Funding solar and wind projects at major facilities.
- **Employee Volunteer Days** – Engaging staff in community clean‑up and tree‑planting events.
- **Supply‑Chain Greening** – Working with partners to adopt low‑carbon practices.

The initiative underscores Example Corp’s dedication to *environmental responsibility* and positions the company as a leader in corporate sustainability.

*For media inquiries, please contact:*  
Press Office – Example Corp  
press@example.com  
+1‑800‑555‑1234

© 2024 Example Corp. All rights reserved.
I’ll now proofread and polish the draft for grammar, brand tone, and readability.
